title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.264 - Prepaid expense
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.264 - Prepaid expense

State Regulations

An expenditure, often recurrent, for future benefits; a
type of deferred charge. Examples: prepaid operating expenses, prepaid rent, taxes, royalties, commissions; unexpired insurance premiums; stationery and
office supplies. Such items are classifiable as current assets and constitute a
part of working capital; they are charged to future operations on the basis of
measurable benefits or on a time or period-charge basis. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
441.264

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
